description: The Book of the Beginning. Covers the genealogy of the Bharata dynasty, birth and childhood of the Pandavas and Kauravas, and events leading to their conflict.
The Book of the Assembly Hall. Describes Yudhishthira’s Rajasuya sacrifice, the game of dice, and the exile of the Pandavas.
The Book of the Forest. Chronicles the 12-year forest exile of the Pandavas and contains many philosophical and moral stories.
The Book of Virata. Describes the Pandavas’ one-year incognito exile in the kingdom of King Virata.
The Book of Effort. Focuses on diplomatic efforts to avoid war and preparations for the Kurukshetra battle.
The Book of Bhishma. Narrates the first 10 days of the Kurukshetra war under Bhishma's command. Contains the Bhagavad Gita.
The Book of Drona. Covers battles under Dronacharya’s leadership and the death of Abhimanyu.
The Book of Karna. Describes Karna’s command of the Kaurava army and his eventual death.
The Book of Shalya. Narrates the final day of the war and the fall of Duryodhana.
The Book of the Sleeping Warriors. Describes Ashwatthama’s night massacre of the Pandava camp.
The Book of Women. Focuses on the grief and lamentations of the women after the war.
The Book of Peace. Bhishma imparts teachings on dharma, governance, and ethics.
The Book of Instructions. Continues Bhishma’s discourse on moral duties and charity.
The Book of the Horse Sacrifice. Describes Yudhishthira’s Ashvamedha Yajna.
The Book of Hermitage Life. Chronicles the retirement of Dhritarashtra and Gandhari.
The Book of Clubs. Describes the destruction of the Yadava clan.
The Book of the Great Journey. The Pandavas renounce their kingdom and depart for the Himalayas.
The Book of Ascension to Heaven. Concludes the epic with Yudhishthira’s ascent to heaven.
